title: 97-100ms full time on 100mb fiber, what gives?
body:
So I'm having this strange constant lag its just enough to notice and it never goes away. I ran a trace route and it appears that its coming from riots own hand offs as you can see my ping is essentially nothing (~17) until it is taken into the hands of "dls-b21-link.telia.net" (~45) and then again being handed to riot  "riot-ic-315570-dls-b21.c.telia.net" (~90).

 I live in Elk Grove, CA

Ive used the hextech repair tool to try to resolve the issue to no avail and it shows Significantly less ping than the trace route and what i experience in game.

Below is the information from the trace route:
|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|                                      WinMTR statistics                                   
|                       Host              -   %  | Sent | Recv | Best | Avrg | Wrst | Last |
|------------------------------------------------|------|------|------|------|------|------|
|                           router.Belkin --------------------------------------------------- 0 |   94 |   94 |    0 |    0 |    2 |    0 |
|                             192.168.2.1 ---------------------------------------------------- 0 |   94 |   94 |    1 |    1 |    3 |    1 |
|      1.184-62-69.ftth.swbr.surewest.net -------- 2 |   90 |   89 |    1 |    4 |   24 |    2 |
|                           172.22.13.153 ------------------------------------------------ 2 |   91 |   90 |    1 |    2 |   17 |    2 |
|                             172.21.2.21 ----------------------------------------------------- 2 |   91 |   90 |    3 |    3 |    6 |    3 |
|     117.98-30-64.ftth.swbr.surewest.net ------ 2 |   90 |   89 |    2 |    3 |   31 |    2 |
|                  sjo-b21-link.telia.net ------------------------------------- 2 |   90 |   89 |    7 |    7 |   10 |    7 |
|                  las-b21-link.telia.net ------------------------------------- 2 |   90 |   89 |   17 |   17 |   30 |   18 |
|                  dls-b21-link.telia.net ------------------------------------- 2 |   91 |   90 |   44 |   45 |   58 |   44 |
|      riot-ic-315570-dls-b21.c.telia.net -------------- 2 |   90 |   89 |   81 |   82 |   94 |   81 |
|                          104.160.134.35 --------------------------------------------- 2 |   91 |   90 |   87 |   88 |   96 |   88 |
|          ae35-br02.chi01.riotdirect.net ------------------ 2 |   91 |   90 |   97 |   97 |  108 |   97 |
|                           104.160.131.3 ------------------------------------------------ 2 |   91 |   90 |   90 |   90 |   97 |   90 |


I'm kind of at a loss here on what i can do to fix this issue as it appears to be Riot and telia.net issue, any help would be great.

replies.body: Hey thanks for this traceroute!  As you suggested, it looks like your routing is taking a crap while hopping through your ISP's nodes.  You should give these logs to a Tier 2 specialist with your ISP support so they can get that looked at.  In the meantime, configuring your DNS via our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide or trying a VPN might be able to re-route you.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=JEGHsbgA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-20T16:04:34.046+0000)
>
> Hey thanks for this traceroute!  As you suggested, it looks like your routing is taking a crap while hopping through your ISP's nodes.  You should give these logs to a Tier 2 specialist with your ISP support so they can get that looked at.  In the meantime, configuring your DNS via our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide or trying a VPN might be able to re-route you.

you say that i should contact my isp about this issue, but it appears that its not their issue, as its already Been in the hands of telia.net / riot at the point in which its spiking. If telia and riot already have it in their hands before it spikes what does contacting my isp solve or what information do i hope to gain from them other than the typical "its not us" kind of response? what am i missing here?

las-b21-link.telia.net hands off to dls-b21-link.telia.net, so thats telia handing it to somewhere else on its own network and its spiking, then again spikes to nearly double when dls-b21-link.telia.net hands it to riot-ic-315570-dls-b21.c.telia.net. 

edit- what kind of information do i need to request/provide and what kind of direction do i need to give them that would improve this situation, i guess im just not seeing the correct course of action once i contact them outside of simply saying here is a trace route i have can you fix this...?

Hey there, your copy of this log should be escalated to a higher-tier specialist with your ISP who can review the impacted node causing the increase.  They should be able to send someone out there to take a look at it, if the issue still persists.  I would let the specialist know that you have some logs on a degrading node so they can escalate it further.

In the meantime, were you able to go over the steps in the connection guide especially with configuring your DNS?

sorry for the long delay between responses i have been extremely busy, so yes i tried using the connection guide and confirmed all of the correct settings and also tried configuring my DNS which netted zero change, i then contacted my ISP and had them view a few of my trace routes and they determined that the issue wasn't within Their network and as such couldn't provide much assistance and that's landed me back at square 1, which is here wondering why... 

| las-b21-link.telia.net ------------------------------------- 2 | 90 | 89 | 17 | 17 | 30 | 18 |
| dls-b21-link.telia.net ------------------------------------- 2 | 91 | 90 | 44 | 45 | 58 | 44 |
| riot-ic-315570-dls-b21.c.telia.net -------------- 2 | 90 | 89 | 81 | 82 | 94 | 81 |
| 104.160.134.35 --------------------------------------------- 2 | 91 | 90 | 87 | 88 | 96 | 88 |
| ae35-br02.chi01.riotdirect.net ------------------ 2 | 91 | 90 | 97 | 97 | 108 | 97 |
| 104.160.131.3 ------------------------------------------------ 2 | 91 | 90 | 90 | 90 | 97 | 90 |

...these nodes appear to be causing my issue and i still have no idea what to do about it.

I viewed my connection via your https://lagreport.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/ website and this is what it shows:

YOUR ISP'S CONNECTION SCORE
Consolidated Comm.
89/100
QUALITY: GOOD
Ethernet	89
Latency	56 ms
Packet Loss
0.69%
Jitter	0 ms

YOUR CONNECTION SCORE
Consolidated Comm.
83/100
Ethernet	83
Latency
90 ms
Packet Loss
0.52%
Jitter	0 ms
Games	42

as you can see I'm getting nearly double the ms response time that the isp score is getting and I've ran every test and tried every setting within your support page.

additional support is needed as i am completely at a loss.

edit: I don't believe i stated this before but this problem **ONLY **happens with league of legends, i have tested other games and have no issues what so ever
